p: Investigators at the Center for Biologics Evaluation and Research at the US FDA created a chimeric virus combining a DENV-2 with the terminal 3′ stem and loop structure of WNV. This virus grew normally in mammalian LLC-MK 2 cells but was severely restricted for growth in C6/36 insect cells and was designated “mutant F” or “mutF.” And in rhesus monkey, immune responses were similar to those of the wild-type virus ( Li et al., 2014, Yang et al., 2016).
